summary: VARIOUS PROBLEMS WITH 2002 HYUNDAI SANTA FE.*MR  THE CONSUMER FEELS SHE MAY HAVE MADE THE WRONG CHOICE WHEN PURCHASING THE VEHICLE.  THE CONSUMER RECEIVED  FALSE HORSEPOWER ADVERTISEMENT CLASS ACTION LAWSUIT  INFORMATION FROM THE MANUFACTURER A MONTH AFTER THE VEHICLE WAS PURCHASED.  AN ECM REPROGRAMMING RECALL WAS RECEIVED BUT ONCE THE REPAIRS WERE MADE ANOTHER PROBLEM SURFACED.  THE CONSUMER ATTEMPTED TO HAVE THE PROBLEM CORRECTED THREE TIMES BUT THE NOISE RECURS NOW LOUDER THAN EVER.  THE CONSUMER HEARD A CLUNKING NOISE WHEN BACKING.  THE TECHNICIAN DETERMINED THAT THE PROBLEM WAS THE FRONT AXLE ASSEMBLY.  *NM

NOISE IN FRONT END SINCE JULY 2002. TOOK CAR TO DEALER APPROX 8 (EIGHT) TIMES SINCE JULY 2002.   ON OR ABOUT APRIL 2004 I WAS NOTIFIED - SOR # 29180-ARM & RACK,BUSHING TO BE REPLACED PROBLEM STILL OCCURS  AS OF JULY 2004 SITUATION IS WORSE THAN BEFORE.   *AK   THE CONSUMER REQUESTED STATUS.   *SC   *JB

WHILE TRAVELLING AT 65 MPH ON A HIGHWAY (STRAIGHT UP AN INCLINE), FRONT LEFT WHEEL AND TIRE BECAME DETACHED FROM THE HUB.   WHEEL AND TIRE REMAINED INTACT AFTER SEPARATION FROM HUB AND BOUNCED DOWN THE HIGHWAY, INDICATING TIRE PRESSURE WAS MAINTAINED ENOUGH TO BOUNCE HIGH IN THE ROADWAY.  UPON INSPECTION, LUG STUD BOLTS WERE MISSING FROM THE HUB.  THERE WAS ALSO A CRACK IN THE HUB THROUGH ONE OF THE LUG STUD BOLT HOLES.  THE POLICE CHECKED THE ROAD FOR ANY HAZARDS WHICH MIGHT HAVE CAUSED THE PROBLEM, BUT NONE WERE FOUND.  DRIVER EXPERIENCED EXTREMELY SHORT DURATION OF INCONSISTENCY OF VEHICLE HANDLING IMMEDIATELY PRIOR TO WHEEL SEPARATION.  *AK

PLASTIC ON CHILD SEAT IS BOWING WITH PRESSURE.   *MR   UPON INSTALLATION OF THE SNUG RIDE BASE WITH ADJUSTABLE FOOT IN FROST OUTRIGHT POSITION, WHEN PRESSURE WAS APPLIED TO PLACE THE SEAT BELT SNUG, THE ADJUSTABLE FOOT POPPED INTO THE CENTER SLOT.   *SC  *JB

EXPERIENCED DELAY AND HARSH SHIFT INTO DRIVE AND REVERSE SINCE 06 JANUARY 2004. BROUGHT IT TO THE DEALER AND PARTS WERE ORDERED.  AUTO IS NOT DRIVABLE AND HAS BEEN AT THE DEALERS SHOP SINCE 02 FEBRUARY 2004.  DEALER SAYS THE PART IS ON A "NATIONAL BACK ORDER.  *JB

GRINDING NOISE COMING FROM FRONT WHEELS.CONTACTED DEALERSHIP SERVICE BUT ISSUE IS TAKING LONG TO BE RESOLVE.AFTER CHECKING NHTSA,REALIZED THERE WAS A TSB ON THE ISSUE(SERVICE BULLETIN # 0340002).MANUFACTURER IS OBVIOUSLY AWARE OF THE ISSUE BUT NOT ACTING ON THE ISSUE.*AK

THE CONSUMER WAS INFORMED VEHICLE FAILED TO CONFORM TO FEDERAL MOTOR VEHICLE SAFETY STANDARD 120.   *PH  THE CONSUMER FEELS HYUNDAI SHOULD RECALL THE VEHICLE INSTEAD OF HAVING THE CONSUMER AFFIX A NEW LABEL OVER THE ORIGINAL LABEL.  *MR    *NM

RECALL NO. #03V520000 CONCERNING TIRE PRESSURE LABEL:  THE DRIVER'S  SIDE FRONT TIRE WAS COMPLETELY BALD.  CONSUMER FELT THAT THE BALDNESS WAS A DIRECT RESULT OF IMPROPER TIRE PRESSURE.   MANUFACTURER INSISTED THAT THEY WERE NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR THE WEAR OF THE TIRE.*AK
STEERING COMPLETELY FAILED.   *LA

WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 55 MPH WITH THE CRUISE CONTROL ENGAGED, THE VEHICLE SUDDENLY DECELERATED.  THE DRIVER HAD TO MANUALLY ACCELERATE TO GET THE VEHICLE UP TO SPEED.  THE DEALER WAS UNABLE TO DETERMINE THE CAUSE OF THE PROBLEM.    *JB    *PH   *NLM
WHILE DRIVING HEARD A KNOCKING NOISE THAT WAS COMING FROM REAR END.  THIS CAUSED THE TRANSMISSION TO FAIL.   VEHICLE TOWED TO DEALER FOR ANALYSIS, AND  MECHANIC REPLACED THE DRIVELINE. *AK
OWNER MANUAL STATED VEHICLE WAS EQUIPPED WITH AN ISO FIX SYSTEM, BUT SYSTEM WAS NEVER INSTALLED. *AK

I AM SINGLE AND NO ONE ELSE HAS ACCESS TO MY CAR, I FUEL IT MYSELF, AND I HAVE HAD THE VEHICLE IN FOR THE ENGINE LIGHT COMING ON, THEY STATED THE GAS CAP IS NOT TIGHT.  I CLICK IT 4 TIMES EVERY TIME TO MAKE SURE SINCE THEY SAID IT WILL COST $ 75.00 TO RESET IT AS IT DOES NOT RESET ITSELF.  THIS TIME WHEN I TOOK IT IN, THE LIGHT CAME ON THEN WENT OFF THEN CAME ON AGAIN, SO SINCE IT DOES NOT SET ITSELF AND THE CAP WAS NOT LOOSE (I CHECKED FIRST THING), THEN I DO NOT SEE HOW THEY CAN SEE IT IS LOOSE.  I EVEN ASKED THEM IF MAYBE THERE WAS A CRACK IN THE CAP OR WHY IT CAME LOOSE, THEY SAID THEY DID NOT KNOW IT WAS JUST LOOSE.  I THINK THERE IS A SENSOR PROBLEM OR GAS CAP CRACK OR PROBLEM BECAUSE THE CAP CAN NOT LOOSEN ITSELF NOR CAN VAPORS ESCAPE WHEN IT IS CLICKED 4 TIMES AND VERY TIGHT AND NOOELSE HAS ACCESS TO MY VEHICLE.*AK

2002 HYUNDAI SANTE FE.AVE HAD 3 ALTERNATORS AND BATTERIED REPLACED ON THIS VEHICLE.  LAST WEEK THE THIRD WAS INSTALLED.  VEHICLE STILL WILL NOT CRANK LIGHTS DIM WIPERS SLOW.  RADIO CUTS OFF WHEN BRAKES APPLIED.  ANTI BRAKE SYSTEM LIGHT COMES ON BATTERY LIGHT COMES ON AND THE LIGHTS FLASH WHEN CAR IS TURNED OFF AND KEY IS OUT OF IGNITION/.*AK

LUG STUD BOLTS FAILED ON ONE WHEEL. WHEN CHECKED DUE TO NOISE FROM THAT WHEEL THREE OF FIVE BOLTS WERE BROKEN OFF. I TRIED TO TIGHTEN ON OF THE TWO REMAINING NUTS, THINKING THE NUTS MAY HAVE JUST COME LOOSE, AND THE BOLT CAME OFF SHOWING ABOUT 10% OF THE BOLT REMAINED, THE REMAINDER HAVING ALREADY BROKEN.*AK

I HAVE THE ELECTRONIC CONTROL HVAC SYSTEM IN MY SANTE FE.  THE AIR CONDITIONING WILL WORK NORMAL FOR A TIME PERIOD.  THEN WHEN IT IS TURNED ON FROM THE OFF POSITION BY USING THE "AUTO" MODE IT WILL SOUND LIKE THE AIR IS BLOWING BUT ONLY A SLIGHT AMOUNT OF AIR WILL COME OUT.  IF IT IS LEFT ON AND IN THE HIGH FAN MODE A DRIPPING SOUND CAN BE HEARD.  THE SYSTEM WILL NOT RESET ITSELF UNTIL THE VEHICLE HAS BEEN TURNED OFF FOR A GOOD LENGTH OF TIME (SOMETIMES HOURS).  THIS IS THE SECOND TIME I HAVE EXPERIENCED THIS SAME PROBLEM.  IT OCCURRED LAST YEAR (IN JULY AND AUGUST 2002) BUT WAS NOT FIXED UNTIL OCTOBER.  THE DEALERS REMEDY WAS TO REPLACE THE TEMPERATURE PROBE IN THE SYSTEM.  IT TOOK WEEKS TO GET THE PART IN AND BY THE TIME IT WAS ACTUALLY REPLACED THE OUTSIDE WEATHER WAS TOO COLD TO PROPERLY TEST THE SYSTEM.  IT WAS OBVIOUSLY NOT THE RIGHT FIX BECAUSE IT IS STILL HAPPENING THIS SUMMER.  THE VEHICLE IS GOING BACK AGAIN FOR REPAIR.*AK
CONSUMER STATES THAT THE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT IS CONSTANTLY ILLUMINATED.  DEALER HAS INSPECTED SEVERAL TIMES BUT CANNOT DETERMINE CAUSE OR CODE.*AK
FRONT BRAKES SQUEALING,NOISE GOES AWAY WHEN BRAKE PEDAL PUSH.  LESS THEN 13K  MILES.  SERVICE MANAGER SAYS THIS IS NOT UNUSUAL FOR THE SANTA FE.    *NLM

THE WINDSHIELD HAS BEGAN TO CRACK FROM THE LOWER RIGHT-HAND CORNER (PASSENGER'S SIDE) UP ABOUT 16" IN AN "S" SHAPED PATTERN. THERE IS -NO- INDICATION OF A ROCK OR OTHER ITEM HITTING THE WINDSHIELD. I HAVE BEEN TOLD BY THE DEALERSHIP (FAIRFAX HYUNDAI, FAIRFAX, VA) THAT IT IS THE RESULT OF A ROCK -BUT- THERE IS -NO_ IMPACT CRATER TO SUGGEST THIS. WHEN QUESTIONED ABOUT "STRESS FRACTURES" I WAS TOLD -THOSE- OCCUR FROM THE "INSIDE-OUT" AND THAT THIS WASN'T A STRESS FRACTURE... I FIND THAT TO BE B.S.  *AK

THE WINDSHIELD HAS BEGUN TO CRACK FROM THE LOWER LEFT HAND CORNER (DRIVER'S SIDE) UP ABOUT 12" IN AN "S" SHAPED PATTERN.  THERE IS NO INDICATION OF A ROCK OR OTHER ITEM STRIKING THE WINDSHIELD.  IT CAME UP OUT OF NOWHERE!    *NLM    THANKS,    L. CHASE

I OWN A 2002 HYUNDAI SANTA FE.  THIS PAST WEEK A ROCK (APPROXIMATELY THE SIZE OF A BASEBALL) FELL OFF OF AN ONCOMING TRUCK AND HIT MY FRONT WINDSHIELD ON THE PASSENGER SIDE.  MY CONCERN IS THAT THE ROCK CAME COMPLETELY THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD, HIT THE DASHBOARD, & LANDED ON THE PASSENGER SIDE FLOOR.  FORTUNATELY MY DAUGHTER WHO WAS SEATED IN THE FRONT PASSENGER SEAT SAW IT COMING & IN A SPLIT SECOND WAS ABLE TO COVER HER FACE & LEAN TOWARDS THE DRIVER'S SIDE.  IF THAT ROCK HAD HIT HER IT WOULD HAVE VERY SERIOUSLY INJURED HER OR WORSE.  I AM VERY CONCERNED THAT THE ROCK CAME COMPLETELY THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD & WONDER IF THEIR IS A DEFECT IN THE SANTA FE.  THE GLASS TECHNICIAN THAT  REPAIRED THE WINDSHIELD SAID THAT ROCK SHOULD NEVER HAVE GOTTEN THROUGH & HE ALSO SAID THAT THE HE FIXES A GREAT NUMBER OF SANTA FE WINDSHIELD.  I REALLY THINK THAT THIS NEEDS TO BE LOOKED INTO.  I HAVE EMAILED HYUNDAI & THEY BASICALLY SAID THEY WOULD ENTER IT INTO THAT DATABASE.  THAT WILL NOT SOLVE THIS PROBLEM.  WE WERE VERY LUCKY IN THIS SITUATION, BUT THE NEXT PERSON MAY NOT BE.  I WILL ALSO BE CONTACTING THE DEALER WHERE I PURCHASED THE VEHICLE TO INFORM THEM.  THANK YOU FOR TAKING THE TIME TO READ MY CONCERN.      *NLM
NOISE  WAS COMING FROM LEFT REAR SIDE DUE TO  REAR SUSPENSION FAILURE.*AK
A NOISE GENERATED FROM THE LEFT REAR OF THE VEHICLE.  *AK  *JB

CAR WOULDN'T START. HAD IT TOWED TO DEALER WHERE CRANK SENSOR WAS REPLACED.  2 DAYS LATER CAR WOULDN'T START AGAIN. HAD IT TOWED BACK TO DEALER WHERE NO PROBLEMS COULD BE FOUND, HOWEVER THE DRIVE BELT TENSIONER ASSEMBLY WAS REPLACED.  2 DAYS LATER CAR WOULDN'T START AGAIN. MANUFACTURER'S HELP LINE RECOMMENDED CHANGING OIL FROM MANUFACTURER'S SUGGESTED 10W30 OIL TO 5W30 OIL. TECHNICIANS AND SERVICE PERSONNEL BELIEVE THAT ORIGINAL PROBLEM IS ACTUALLY RELATED TO COMPUTER SYSTEM IN CAR. THEY BELIEVE THAT THE PROBLEM IS STILL NOT FIXED.         TS
AFTER RELEASE FOOT OFF GAS PEDAL VEHICLE STARTED ACCELERATING. VEHICLE HAS BEEN AT DEALER FOR TEN DAYS, AND TECHNICIAN CAN DUPLICATE PROBLEM. PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.*AK

WHILE DRIVING, CONSUMER NOTICED SMOKE COMING FROM UNDER THE HOOD.  THEN A FIRE BEGAN UNDER THE HOOD.  DEALER DIAGNOSED THAT A HOSE FROM THE RADIATOR WAS LOOSE FROM THE CLAMP CAUSING COOLANT TO LEAK ONTO ENGINE STARTING FIRE. TS

I COMPLAINED TO THE DEALERSHIP THAT THERE IS A WHISTLE/WHINE IN THE TRANSMISION AT 30-35 MPH DURING DECELERATION. THEY REPORTED THIS TO BE A CHARECTERISTIC OF THIS CAR. I HAVE DRIVEN OTHER SANTA FE'S AND NO WHISTLE/WHINE.  DT

I COMPLAINED ABOUT LOUDNESS IN THE EXHAUST.  DEALERSHIP COULD NOT DUPLICATE THE CONCERN. THE CAR IS DEFINITELY LOUDER THEN WHEN WE PURCHASED IT 2200 MILES AGO. THIS IS NOT AN ACCEPTABLE CONCLUSION BY THE DEALERSHIP.  DT

CONSUMER STATES TURNED VEHICLE OFF AND REMOVED KEY FROM IGNITION.  ALL POWER WINDOWS WERE STILL FUNCTIONING AND CHILD'S HEAD BECOME STUCK IN PASSENGER REAR WINDOW.  CONSUMER STATED POWER WINDOWS CONTINUED TO OPERATE W/VEHICLE TURNED OFF AND KEY IN OR OUT OF IGNITION.       MR

WHILE IN STOP AND GO TRAFFIC, THE DRIVER REMOVED HIS FOOT FROM THE BRAKE PEDAL AND THE VEHICLE SUDDENLY ACCELERATED AT A HIGH SPEED AND RAN INTO THE BACK OF ANOTHER VEHICLE.  *NLM  ON A SECOND OCCASION WHILE PARKING IN A GARAGE THE VEHICLE SURGED FORWARD AT A TREMENDOUS SPEED, ON THE THIRD OCCASION WHEN STARTING THE PARKED VEHICLE THE VEHICLE ACCELERATED AT A TREMENDOUS SPEED.  *SCC

THE LEFT REAR PASSENGER SEATBELT DOES NOT LOCK INTO THE BUCKLE NEXT TO IT , BUT LOCKS INTO THE CENTER POSITION BUCKLE ( MIDDLE PASSENGER BUCKLE ).  THE BUCKLE NEXT TO THE LEFT PASSENGER STATES "CENTER".  WHEN SEATBELTS ARE BUCKLED THE LEFT AND MIDDLE PASSENGERS BELT AND BUCKLE HAVE OVERLAP.   I  HAVE DISCUSSED THIS WITH THE SALESMAN AND SERVICE DEPARTMENT - THEIR SOLUTION IS TO LEAVE THE PLASTIC BUCKLE RETAINER IN PLACE FOR THE BUCKLE NEXT TO THE LEFT REAR PASSENGER OR COMMENT ITS KOREAN ; AS IF THIS IS AN ACCEPTABLE MANUFACTURER'S DEFECT.*AK
ALTERNATOR DOES NOT CHARGE.  LIGHTS DIM.  WIPERS SLOW.  BATTERY DIES. *AK

VEHICLE HAD 1,300 MILES WHEN  OWNER BEGAN TO MOVE  VEHICLE.  OWNER PUSHED BRAKE PEDAL AND  VEHICLE BEGAN TO SHAKE.   VEHICLE ACCELERATED OUT OF CONTROL IN REVERSE.  IT SUSTAINED EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO REAR AND PROPERTY.  VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A DEALERSHIP, VEHICLE WAS STOLEN OFF  DEALERS LOT.  VEHICLE HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS TOTALED.   PLEASE DESCRIBE DETAILS.  *AK

THERE IS A SKID PLATE THAT IS MISSING FROM THE FRONT WHEEL DRIVE , THIS COULD CAUSE A FRACTURE TO OIL PAN IF ANY DEBRIS WOULD STUCK IT. THE VEHICLES WITH FOUR WHEEL DRIVE HAVE A SKID PLATE, BUT FRONT WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLES DON'T. THE DEALER HAS BEEN CONTACTED. *AK   *NLM
BROKE CATALYTIC CONVERTER ON 60 DAY OLD 2002 SANTA FE!*AK

components: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,UNKNOWN OR OTHER
summary: I HAVE HAD MY 2002 SANTA FE LX FOR ONLY 60 DAYS AND THE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT CAME ON A WEEK AGO. WHEN I CALLED THE SERVICE CENTER THEY TOLD ME IT WOULD BE AT LEAST A WEEK TILL THEY COULD LOOK AT IT, AND THAT DRIVING IT WITH THE LIGHT ON WOULDN'T HURT IT. FIVE DAYS LATER THE CAR WOULD NOT SHIFT OUT OF FIRST GEAR WHEN GOING UP ANY HILL WHEN IN AUTOMATICE MODE.  NEEDLESS TO SAY I TOOK IT STRAIGHT TO THE GARAGE...I JUST HEARD FROM THE MECHANIC YESTERDAY AND MY SHIFTING PROBLEMS APPARENTLY WERE CAUSED FROM A BOKEN CATALYTIC CONVERTER! I CAN'T IMAGINE HOW THIS COULD BE BROKE ON A 60 DAY OLD CAR! SO FAR I AM NOT TOO IMPRESSED WITH THE SERVICE RECORD OF THE SANTA FE! I HAVE ALREADY HAD IT IN THE BODY SHOP TO HAVE A PART OF THE ROCKER PANEL REPAINTED BECAUSE IT WAS PEELING. IT STARTED PEELING AFTER I HAD THE CAR 1 WEEK, AND CONTINUED TO PROGRESSIVELY PEEL UNTIL THE DEALER AGREED TO PAINT IT.*AK

WHILE TRAVELING 70 MPH FRONT RIGHT PASSENGER'S WINDOW EMPLODED WHILE BEING OCCUPIED.  THERE WAS NO PASSING OF ANOTHER VEHICLE WHEN THIS HAPPENED.  OWNER  INDICATED THAT SHE WAS DRIVING BY AN OPEN FIELD.  PLEASE DESCRIBE DETAILS. *AK

VEHICLE WAS PURCHASED ON 04/25/02, AND WITHIN 2 MONTHS ENGINE WAS REPLACED. ALSO,  TRANSMISSION REPLACED TWICE, AND  THERE WAS A MAJOR OIL LEAK.  VEHICLE HAS BEEN WITH DEALER FOR THE LAST 35 DAYS.  DEALER HAS BEEN IN COMMUNICATION WITH  MANUFACTURER  WITH NO RESOLUTION.*AK

MY SON WAS DRIVING AT 25MPH, THE CAR ACCELARATED ON IT'S OWN. HE ALMOST HIT A TREE. HE BRAKED, BUT IT WOULD STOP ACCELERATING. HE PUT IT IN NEUTRAL AND WITH THE FOOT ON THE BRAKE, HE PULLED THE EMERGENCY BRAKE AND THE CAR STOPPED. WHEN HE OUT IT IN PARK, HE STARTED IT AGAIN AND THE ENGINE RACED ABOVE 7WITH OUT TOUCHING ACCELARATOR. HE COULD HAVE GOT KILLED. WE HAD THE CAR TOWED.*AKI

THERE IS VIBRATION IN DRIVELINE AND ON FLOOR OF VEHICLE,  CONSUMER IS DRIVING AT MORE THEN 50 MPH, CONTACTED DEALER, AFTER TWO ATTEMPTS DEALER CLAIMS VEHICLE NO LONGER HAS VIBRATION BUT VIBRATION STILL EXIST. *AK  *TT

I HAVE DETAILED INFORMATION ON WHAT I BELIEVE IS A COVER-UP BY THE HYUNDAI CORPORATION REGARDING THE 2002 HYUNDAI SANTE FE.  THE PROBLEM WAS NOTICED THE DAY AFTER I BOUGHT THE VEHICLE.  I'VE HAD MY VEHICLE IN FOR SERVICE AT LEAST 4 TIMESFOR THE FOLLOWING PROBLEM:  WHEN I START THE VEHICLE UP EVERY MORNING, THE RPM'S RACE TO OVER 2000 AND DECLINES SLIGHTLY TO ABOUT 1500 AND STAYS AT THIS SPEED FOR ABOUT 2 MINUTES.  WHEN I PULL FROM A PARKING SPACE (WITHOUT TOUCHING THE GAS PEDAL), THE SPEEDOMETER HOVER BETWEEN 10 AND 15 MILES AN HOUR, AGAIN, WITHOUT TOUCHING THE ACCELERATOR.  AS A RESULT OF THIS VERY HIGH "IDLING" PROBLEM, I BELIEVE IT IS A VERY REAL DANGER TO NOT ONLY THE DRIVERS OF THESE VEHICLES BUT ANY POSSIBLE PEDESTRIANS OR PROPERTY THAT MAY BE STRUCK.  THE HYUNDAI CORPORATION DENIES THIS IS A PROBLEM AND SAY IT IS VERY COMMON FOR THIS VEHICLE.  WHEN I ASK FOR DETAILS REGARDING THEIR TESTING THEY REFUSE TO SEND IT TO ME. I HAVE DETAILED INFORMATION (NAMES, DATES TIMES AND PLACES) CONCERNING  WHAT I BELIEVE SHOULD BE A "RECALL" BUT IS BEING COVERED UP BY HYUNDAI.  PLEASE CONTACT ME FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION.   THANKS. *AK
RIGHT SIDE SEATBELTS WERE PUT IN  INCORRECTLY,  THEY WERE PUT IN BACKWARDS. DEALERSHIP IS AWARE OF  PROBLEM.

THIS BRAND NEW SANTA FE LEAKED OIL FROM  A SEAL FROM THE FRONT TIRE ALL OVER MY BRAND NEW CONCRETE GARAGE FLOOR. I HAVE ASKED THE DEALER AT THE TIME I PHONED THEM WITH THE PROBLEM TO PLEASE TAKE THIS CAR BACK THAT I DO NOT WANT A UNSAFE CAR AND FEEL THAT A CAR THAT BREAKS DOWN IN LESS THAN FORTY EIGHT HOURS OF OWNING IS A REAL PROBLEM. THEY AT KELLY TOLD ME THIS REQUEST WOULD NOT BE FILLED AND YET THE OWNER MIKE KELLY TOLD ME HOW MY LIFES PRIORTY'S ARE MESSED UP THAT I LET SOMETHING LIKE THIS UPSET ME AND WHICH HELPED RUIN MY HOLIDAY'S WITH THE STRESS OF WORRYING ABOUT A NEW CAR AND A CAR PAYMENT OF 800.00 AND PAYING FOR INSRUANCE AND YET NOT A CAR TO DRIVE. HE SAID THAT IS WHY THE HYUNDAI COMPANY PROVIDES A REALLY NICE WARRENTY. I FEEL AS THEY SHOULD HAVE TO TAKE THIS CAR BACK.
